sen.j: 中西昇（なかにしのぼる、生没年不詳）は新選組伍長。
sen.e: Noboru NAKANISHI (date of his birth and death is unknown) was a corporal in the Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
Noboru NAKANISHI (date of his birth and death is unknown) was a corporal in the Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
Noboru NAKANISHI (date of his birth and death is unknown) was a corporal in the Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
He later became a Goryo-eji (guards of Imperial mausoleums).
He later became a Goryo-eji (guards of Imperial mausoleums).
He later became a Goryo-eji (guards of Imperial mausoleums).

sen.j: 多くの書物に上州出身と書かれているが、島田魁の「英名録」には川越藩出身と書かれている。
sen.e: While many books wrote he had come from Joshu Province, "Eimeiroku (a list of the Shinsengumi members)" compiled by Kai SHIMADA wrote he had come from the Kawagoe Domain.
While many books wrote he had come from Joshu Province, "Eimeiroku (a list of the Shinsengumi members)" compiled by Kai SHIMADA wrote he had come from the Kawagoe Domain.
While many books wrote he had come from Joshu Province, "Eimeiroku" (a list of the Shinsengumi members) compiled by Kai SHIMADA wrote he had come from the Kawagoe Domain.

sen.j: 出生年は分かっておらず、北辰一刀流伊東精一、伊東甲子太郎（鈴木大蔵）の弟子であった。
sen.e: Noboru NAKANISHI, whose birth date is unknown, was a disciple of Seiichi ITO and Kashitaro ITO (or Daizo SUZUKI) of the Hokushin-Itto-ryu kenjutsu (a classical sword tradition).
Noboru NAKANISHI, whose birth date is unknown, was a disciple of Seiichi ITO and Kashitaro ITO (or Daizo SUZUKI) of the Hokushin-Itto-ryu kenjutsu (a classical sword tradition).
Noboru NAKANISHI, whose birth date is unknown, was a disciple of Seiichi ITO and Kashitaro ITO (or Daizo SUZUKI) of the Hokushin Itto school (a classical sword tradition).
sen.cmt: the Hokushin Itto schoolに訂正しました。

sen.j: 剣の実力は師範代を務めるまで至った。
sen.e: He attained proficiency in swordsmanship to be an acting master.
He attained proficiency in swordsmanship that allowed him to become an acting master.
He attained proficiency in swordsmanship that allowed him to become an acting master.

sen.j: 元治元年十月、近藤勇や藤堂平助の勧誘され上洛。
sen.e: Persuaded by Isami KONDO and Heisuke TODO, he went to the capital (Kyoto) in 1864.
Persuaded by Isami KONDO and Heisuke TODO, he went to the capital (Kyoto) in 1864.
Persuaded by Isami KONDO and Heisuke TODO, he went to the capital (Kyoto) in 1864.

sen.j: 伊藤らと共に新選組に加盟した。
sen.e: He joined the Shinsengumi along with ITO and others.
sen.cmt: 伊藤は伊東のことと解釈しました。
sen.e: He joined the Shinsengumi along with ITO and others.
He joined the Shinsengumi along with Ito and others.

sen.j: その際の第二次組織編成では、斎藤一の四番組に属し、伍長となっている。
sen.e: In the 2nd organizational restructuring of Shinsengumi, he belonged to the fourth unit of Shinsengumi headed by Hajime SAITO, and assumed the post of corporal.
In the 2nd organizational restructuring of Shinsengumi, he belonged to the fourth unit of Shinsengumi headed by Hajime SAITO, and assumed the post of corporal.
In the 2nd organizational restructuring of Shinsengumi, he belonged to the fourth unit of Shinsengumi headed by Hajime SAITO, and assumed the post of corporal.

sen.j: 慶応三年三月の御陵衛士の拝命により、新選組から分離。
sen.e: Appointed to a Goryo-eji in 1867, he seceded from the Shinsengumi.
Appointed to a Goryo-eji in 1867, he seceded from the Shinsengumi.
Appointed to a Goryo eji (guards of Imperial mausoleums) in March, 1867, he seceded from the Shinsengumi.
sen.cmt: 御陵衛士→Goryo eji (guards of Imperial mausoleums)March, 補足しました。

sen.j: 高台寺の月真院に移る。
sen.e: He moved to Gesshin-in subtemple of Kodai-ji Temple.
He moved to Gesshin-in subtemple of Kodai-ji Temple.
He moved to Gesshin-in sub-temple of Kodai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: ハイフンに補足しました。

sen.e: Different story
Different story
Different story

sen.j: 中西の行動は不思議な点が多い。
sen.e: There are a lot of mysteries in NAKANISHI.
There are a lot of mysteries in NAKANISHI.
There are a lot of mysteries in Nakanishi.

sen.j: 新選組の後の話に、新選組在籍時、篠崎慎八郎と称していた佐原太郎が中西の手によって、殺害されたと同胞の阿部十郎が語っている。
sen.e: Juro ABE, a comrade of NAKANISHI, recollected the Shinsengumi later and told that Taro SAHARA who had called himself Shinpachiro SHINOZAKI at that time was killed by NAKANISHI.
sen.cmt: 阿部十郎は誰の同胞か不明
sen.e: Juro ABE, a comrade of NAKANISHI, recollected the Shinsengumi later and told that Taro SAHARA who had called himself Shinpachiro SHINOZAKI at that time was killed by NAKANISHI.
Juro ABE, a comrade of Nakanishi, recollected the Shinsengumi later and told that Taro SAHARA who had called himself Shinpachiro SHINOZAKI at that time was killed by Nakanishi.

sen.j: しかし、同胞の篠原泰之進は久留米新激隊の田口次郎なるものが殺害したと書き残している。
sen.e: Another comrade Yasunoshin SHINOHARA, however, left a note that Jiro Taguchi of the Kurume shingekitai (corps consisted of masterless samurai in the Kurume Domain) murdered SAHARA.
Another comrade Yasunoshin SHINOHARA, however, left a note that Jiro Taguchi of the Kurume shingekitai (corps consisted of masterless samurai in the Kurume Domain) murdered SAHARA.
Another comrade Yasunoshin SHINOHARA, however, left a note that Jiro TAGUCHI of the Kurume Shingekitai (corps consisted of masterless samurai in the Kurume Domain) murdered Sahara.
sen.cmt: TAGUCHI大文字にしました。Shingekitai大文字にしました。Sahara小文字にしました。
